item.title: Fairgames Can Look to One of Gaming’s Biggest Franchises For Inspiration
item.description:
PlayStation 's live-service push has been a bit of a mixed bag so far. In the span of just 12 months, Sony has canceled The Last of Us ' multiplayer game, which was set to be the company's flagship live-service product, and it released Concord , which was pulled from storefronts and shut down just two weeks after launch. But PlayStation also released Helldivers 2 between those two events, which sold 12 million copies in its first three months and broke records to become PlayStation's fastest-selling game of all time.

It seems likely that PlayStation is now approaching all live-service projects in active development with caution, and that likely includes Haven Studios' Fairgames . To succeed, every live-service game needs a unique hook, and while Fairgames ' PvPvE heist loop looks fun, it might want to borrow an old mechanic from Call of Duty to get it over the finish line.

Fairgames Should Take Inspiration from Call of Duty: Black Ops' Wager Matches

Call of Duty: Black Ops' Wager Matches Explained

Introduced in 2010's Call of Duty: Black Ops and then never seen again, Wager Matches allowed players to bet their CoD Points in a series of party game modes. Six players would join a Wager Match, pay the buy-in specific to that mode, and compete to earn their share of the prize money. The player ranked 1st in the lobby at the end of a match would receive 50% of the pot, the 2nd spot would get 30%, the 3rd spot would get 20%, and the rest of the lobby would walk away with nothing.

Call of Duty: Black Ops ' Wager Matches gave players four party modes to choose from, including Sticks and Stones, One in the Chamber, Gun Game, and Sharpshooter. Players were also given a few different playlists to choose from, each one requiring a different buy-in from the player. The Ante Up playlist required a small buy-in of just 10 CoD Points, while the incredibly risky High Roller playlist required an absurd buy-in of 10,000 CoD Points.

Back in 2010, CoD Points were simply a set of in-game currency that could be earned easily through gameplay, and could be used to purchase new weapons, camos, and Killstreaks. As such, wagering CoD Points struck a nice balance of feeling thrilling while not risking anything that couldn't be earned back in just a few hours.

Wager Matches never returned to Call of Duty , and they likely never will, given that CoD Points are now purchased using real-world cash.

How Fairgames Could Put its Own Spin on Black Ops' Wager Match System

Based on its debut trailer from May 2023 and the accompanying PS Blog post, Haven Studios' Fairgames revolves around competitive heists, where players need to form teams, rob from the rich, and fend off other heist crews looking to claim the prize for themselves. It seems fair to assume that Fairgames will revolve around money, and it could make that an even more integral part of the experience by borrowing Call of Duty: Black Ops ' Wager Match system.

Before setting off on a heist in Fairgames , players could use their earned in-game cash to place bets on various match conditions, such as being able to extract within a certain time limit, or being able to take down a certain number of guards with specific weapons. Completing these bets could reward players with more cash to use on upgrades and new gear. That small addition could keep players engaged with Fairgames ' live-service loop for a bit longer.

Fairgames is in development for PlayStation 5 and PC.

MORE: Why PS5 Players Should Keep an Open Mind About Fairgames

item.title: Best FPS Games From Each Year of the 90s
item.description: The 1990's was one of the best decades for FPS games. From Doom to Quake, these are the best titles from every year in the 90s.

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Remake: 18 Weapons You Should Upgrade As Soon As Possible, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Resident Evil 4 Remake offers diverse weapons like the Magnum, Matilda, and deadly knives for players to choose from and enhance through upgrades.
  • Upgrading weapons is crucial for combat effectiveness in the game, as each weapon comes with unique strengths and weaknesses that can be improved.
  • The arsenal in Resident Evil 4 Remake provides players with a balanced mix of firepower and precision, catering to different playstyles and combat scenarios.

Resident Evil 4 Remake is a highly anticipated game that surpasses its predecessor, which was already considered a classic masterpiece. The game features a fine balance between action and horror, providing an exceptional experience for both old and new fans. The weapons are a critical part of the gameplay experience. There are many weapons available, ranging from pistols and shotguns to rocket launchers.

Each weapon has unique strengths and weaknesses, and upgrading them can make a huge difference in how effective they are in combat. Upgrades are available in the merchant shop, which appears throughout the game, allowing players to purchase new weapons, upgrade existing ones, and sell unused items for extra cash. The Resident Evil 4 Remake proves to be an example of how a remake should present itself, and it proves once again the masterful way Capcom treats its fan-favorite games.

Updated January 1, 2025 by Vlad Mazanko: The Resident Evil 4 Remake unsurprisingly delivers exceptional replay value, offering players a range of weapons to unlock and upgrade across multiple playthroughs. Given that players won't have nearly enough money to upgrade everything during their first run, the allure of revisiting the game in New Game+ mode is strong. In NG+, players can steadily grow more powerful, expanding their arsenal of deadly tools to tackle each scenario more efficiently.

This updated list covers nearly every weapon available in RE4 Remake, emphasizing their unique perks that can prove invaluable in specific situations. However, deluxe edition bonus weapons ( Skull Shaker and Sentinel Nine ), as well as the most challenging ones to unlock — such as the Primal Knife , Chicago Sweeper , and Handcannon — are excluded. These weapons are not considered priorities for upgrading due to the significant time and effort required to obtain them.

18 CQBR Assault Rifle

A Full-Auto Rifle With High Damage Output But Excessive Ammo Consumption

Ammunition

Rifle Ammo

Cost

40,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

330,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 7

Obtained for free during Chapter 10, the CQBR Assault Rifle in Resident Evil 4 Remake might seem like the ultimate weapon in its category. While it excels in specific situations — boasting full-auto fire, an incredibly fast rate of fire, a large magazine, and the fastest reload speed among rifles — its heavy ammo consumption is a significant drawback. Sure, it's satisfying to unload half a magazine of high-cost rounds into an enemy's face, but in most cases, the CQBR is highly impractical for regular use.

The weapon's special perk, which increases Power by 1.5x, is a nice addition, yet even with this upgrade, the CQBR's damage output is only slightly higher than that of the fully upgraded Stingray rifle. The Stingray, however, is much more versatile and cost-effective, making it the better choice in most scenarios. That said, the CQBR shines in specific combat scenarios. With its rapid-fire capability and compatibility with the Biosensor Scope, it can be an excellent choice for quickly taking down the dreaded Regenerators — perfect for moments when survival matters more than conserving ammo.

17 Striker

Large Magazine Size Offers Limited Advantage For The Shotgun Weapon Class

Ammunition

Shotgun Shells

Cost

38,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

374,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 6

The Striker is the last shotgun to become available in Resident Evil 4 Remake , appearing in Chapter 10 for 38,000 Ptas. It occupies a rather unconventional niche within its category. While it boasts the highest fire rate and a massive drum magazine, it suffers from the lowest damage per shell among all shotguns. Its unique perk upgrade doubles its magazine size to an astounding 48 shells, essentially eliminating the need to reload — assuming players have enough ammo to fully load it at least once. Despite this, it's hard to find scenarios in the game where the Striker's strengths are genuinely advantageous.

Much like the CQBR Assault Rifle , the Striker's ability to burn through ammo quickly can feel inefficient. In most situations, earlier shotguns with higher damage per round and better accuracy are far more practical. Additionally, the Striker is the most expensive shotgun to fully upgrade, requiring a staggering 374,000 Ptas, making it one of the priciest weapons to max out in the entire game.

16 Broken Butterfly Magnum

A Magnum With Unparalleled Damage

Ammunition

Magnum Ammo

Cost

42,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

414,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 3

The Broken Butterfly is a Magnum-type weapon that suffers from rather poor accuracy, meaning players have to place each shot very carefully. However, with max upgrades, the Broken Butterfly has the highest damage per shot in the game (40.5), which alone should be enough to make some players heavily invest in this gun to reach its devastating 1.5 power perk.

As with all Magnums, this revolver offers great penetration, allowing for killing several targets with just one bullet. Due to its accuracy issues, it might be best to save these valuable rounds only for the toughest bosses when players are certain they'll hit their weak spots for maximum damage.

15 Fighting Knife

A Deadly Knife With Almost Four Times The Damage Of The Default

Ammunition

N/A

Cost

20,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

183,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

1 x 4

Jack Krauser's battle knife is a deadly weapon that significantly surpasses the default Combat Knife in terms of raw damage. This comes at the cost of being more fragile, which could be the difference between life and death in RE4 Remake .

Considering that knives in Resident Evil 4 Remake are rarely used for damage (except for a few boss battles against Krauser), the Fighting Knife is a somewhat questionable choice for Leon's everyday life. However, some enthusiasts might find it useful when completely out of ammo. Additionally, some might wish to stick to this knife because of its stylish looks.

14 Blacktail

Impressive Damage And Fire Rate Packed Into The Smallest Weapon Size

Ammunition

Handgun Ammo

Cost

24,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

301,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 2

There's no shortage of solid handguns in Resident Evil 4 Remake , but the Blacktail stands out as a particularly notable option. Available starting in Chapter 7, the Blacktail's most distinct trait is its compact size — it's the smallest ranged weapon in the game. For players who prefer to travel light or carry a diverse arsenal, this makes it an appealing choice. However, its small size comes with a drawback: the Blacktail cannot be outfitted with any gun attachments, including the fan-favorite laser sight.

The Blacktail isn't just about portability; it also delivers impressive firepower. With damage per shot second only to the Red9 and a unique 1.5x Power perk, this pistol packs a punch in a small package. However, players should also consider its cost. The Blacktail is the most expensive handgun to fully upgrade, requiring a hefty investment of 301,000 Ptas — nearly 100,000 more than the SG-09 R or Punisher . It's undeniably a powerful and convenient sidearm, but its high price tag might make some think twice. The choice is yours.

13 Matilda Handgun

An SMG-Pistol Hybrid That Allows For Three-Round Burst Fire

Ammunition

Handgun Ammo

Cost

20,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

298,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 3

The Matilda is rather unique in its handgun category due to its attachable stock that allows for three-round bursts, placing this weapon somewhat between pistols and SMGs. Considering it's much easier to get handgun ammo in Resident Evil 4 Remake , the Matilda can serve as a great alternative to SMGs, with the downside of chewing through ammo incredibly fast.

This weapon's benefits include a quick rate of fire, allowing the Matilda to take down weaker enemies extremely fast, and making it very useful against multiple enemies in tight spaces. Don't forget this weapon's extended magazine when fully upgraded, which further blurs the line between a handgun and an SMG.

12 LE 5 SMG

An SMG Capable Of Easily Taking Down Even Regenerators

Ammunition

Submachine Gun Ammo

Cost

35,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

273,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 6

The LE 5 is a great overall SMG, outperforming the TMP in damage and accuracy, but inferior in other key areas such as magazine size and rate of fire. Yet, some might still opt for this weapon instead of the default choice because of its special traits.

Not only does this SMG have penetration power, but it is also compatible with various scopes, including the Biosensor Scope, making it a great choice for quickly taking down several Regenerators at once. All in all, investing in the LE 5 might prove very beneficial, as it is a very versatile and economical weapon that can come in handy in almost every combat scenario.

11 W-870 Shotgun

A Great Weapon For Crowd Control

Ammunition

Shotgun Shells

Cost

12,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

272,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

8 x 2

The W-870's widespread can hit multiple enemies at once, making it a great shotgun for most of the game. Its limited ammo capacity means players will have to be strategic in when and where they use it. It should be upgraded quickly, as it's accessible to players from Chapter 1 until the end.

To maximize its effectiveness, it is recommended for players to aim for the head or other vulnerable points to deal the most damage possible. With the right upgrades and careful use, the W-870 can be a reliable and powerful weapon throughout the full playthrough of Resident Evil 4 .

10 Punisher Handgun

A Unique Pistol With Great Penetration Effect

Ammunition

Handgun Ammo

Cost

10,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

209,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 3

The Punisher is often overlooked by players, but perhaps it shouldn't be. It's true that without upgrades, this gun is relatively weak, but it has one significant advantage. With its penetration power, this handgun can hit several targets with each shot, making it potentially the most economical firearm in Leon's arsenal. It is also suitable for taking down armored or shielded enemies, and even Regenerators when players know where to place their shots.

That alone could prove valuable on higher difficulties, where resources are severely limited. On top of that is the gun's extended magazine, laser sight compatibility, and great accuracy. Fans might just wish to trade all other handguns in favor of the Punisher, especially given that this pistol is the most affordable to fully upgrade.

9 SR M1903 Rifle

A Deadly Rifle But Only When You Are Out Of Enemies' Range

Ammunition

Rifle Ammo

Cost

12,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

247,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

1 x 9

The SR M1903 is a powerful rifle that offers high-precision damage and is ideal for taking out enemies from a distance. Its cons are, however, the slow firing rate and the reload animation that takes Leon out of the scope view. This can be frustrating in fast-paced combat situations, but the high-precision damage makes up for it.

To make the most of the SR M1903, it's important to keep your distance from enemies and engage them from afar. It's worth noting that the SR M1903 is also the most affordable rifle in RE4 Remake , and its upgrades are just as cheap when compared to other rifles. Its power and precision make it a worthwhile investment, especially during boss fights.

8 Killer7 Magnum

For Certain And Quick Elimination Of Even The Deadliest Threats

Ammunition

Magnum Ammo

Cost

77,700 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

428,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 3

The Killer7's critical headshot damage is higher than any other gun in the game, and it can be a real help in taking down bosses. This Magnum is the best option when players are facing single, powerful enemies that cannot be defeated with conventional weapons.

It has a good ammo capacity, but its ammunition can be quite difficult to acquire. Therefore, this weapon should be preserved and used only on more difficult enemies. Its upgrades come in handy since they transform the gun into a real head-shooting helper.

7 Red9 Handgun

One Of The Most Powerful Pistols In The Game

Ammunition

Handgun Ammo

Cost

14,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

284,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 3

One of the most popular weapons in RE4 Remake is the Red9 . The weapon returns in the Remake, but it has one twist: the stock attachment isn't available right away. To obtain the Red9's stock, players will need to progress through the game until they complete the house fight along with Luis in Chapter 5.

Once the stock is acquired, the Red9 becomes much more effective, with its colossal Power and increased Precision. However, the upgrades that transform the Red9 into an impressive handgun are costly, as the final Power upgrade costs 65,000 Pesetas, and the Exclusive upgrade 100,000 Pesetas.

6 Bolt Thrower

A Unique Weapon Whose Mines Can Serve Players Well

Ammunition

Bolts

Cost

10,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

230,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 5

The Bolt Thrower is one of the new weapons added to Resident Evil 4 . It's perfect for a more stealth-based playthrough, as it only immobilizes the enemies without attracting the other's attention. Even though on its own, the weapon doesn't deal a lot of damage, it can be upgraded to launch mines.

To get the most out of the Bolt Thrower, players should first upgrade its Power and Ammo Capacity. Overall, the Bolt Thrower is a good addition to the remake and a must-have for gamers looking for a more stealth playthrough.

5 TMP SMG

Reliable Weapon For The Hordes Of Weaker Enemies

Ammunition

Submachine Gun Ammo

Cost

10,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

243,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 3

The TMP submachine gun is a valuable addition to players' arsenal, but acquiring it may be a challenge for new players as its location is not hinted at in the game. However, once players do obtain it, the weapon's large magazine and fast fire rate make it perfect for aiming at enemy mobs and hitting most of the targets.

Although its low precision makes it more suitable for short distances, it can still be effective if a safe distance is maintained from enemies to avoid being grabbed. The TMP can be upgraded to improve its accuracy, firepower, and reload speed, making it a reliable weapon to have in players' inventory.

4 Stingray Rifle

Not The Deadliest Rifle, But Surely The Most Versatile

Ammunition

Rifle Ammo

Cost

30,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

356,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 7

The Stingray rifle is a must-have weapon, even if it may take up a significant amount of storage space. Its perks and power make it worth the investment, as it proves extremely versatile and effective against large enemies.

It allows players to engage enemies from different distances, and while it may deal slightly less damage than other rifles, its other stats more than make up for it. The weapon should be bought from the merchant as soon as it becomes available, and its upgrades should be purchased to unlock its true potential.

3 Riot Gun Shotgun

Shotgun With Increased Accuracy And Fire Rate

Ammunition

Shotgun Shells

Cost

28,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

320,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

2 x 8

The Riot Gun is a good weapon for players who are looking for a balance between power, speed, and accuracy. These characteristics can be upgraded to perform even better during combat. Notably, it is less effective against groups of weaker enemies, making it more suitable for high-value targets.

The weapon is definitely worth the investment for those planning on using shotguns as their primary weapon. It has the second-highest firepower of all the shotguns, making it a reliable option when facing off against tougher enemies and bosses. Therefore, with its fast rate of fire, the Riot Gun can deal a lot of damage in a short amount of time.

2 Combat Knife

An Invaluable Tool For Survivability And Escaping Death

Ammunition

N/A

Cost

10,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

150,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

1 x 3

The Combat Knife is one of the most important tools in Leon's arsenal. While in the original game, it was simply a backup weapon, now it's a critical component in the player's combat strategy. The knife mechanics have been greatly improved, as it can now be used to parry enemy attacks and deal significant damage.

Upgrading the knife makes it even more deadly, allowing players to take down enemies with fewer strikes and conserving precious ammunition. With the difficult decisions regarding resource management, upgrading the knife can make all the difference in Leon's survival.

1 SG-09 R Handgun

Leon's Starting Weapon Is Also One Of The Most Effective And Versatile

Ammunition

Handgun Ammo

Cost

8,000 Pesetas

Full Upgrade Cost

224,000 Pesetas

Inventory Size

3 x 2

The SG-09 R is a versatile weapon that can be used effectively in a variety of situations. Its solid stats in all categories make it a dependable starting weapon, and its upgrades are relatively affordable. One drawback of the SG-09 R is its slow rate of fire, making it more suitable for close to mid-range distances where accuracy and power are more important than speed.

Additionally, the SG-09 R's ability to stun enemies can be a useful tool for conserving ammo and dealing damage with melee attacks. Overall, the SG-09 R is a reliable weapon that becomes undeniably great after being upgraded at the merchant's shop. Since players can use it from start to finish, it is recommended to be upgraded as soon as possible to become even more helpful.

item.title: The Next God of War Series Shouldn’t Miss The Chance To Have Another Heimdall
item.description:
One of the God of War franchise's greatest strengths is how it integrates mythology into its action and narrative. Every second of the original God of War Greek Saga is steeped in real-world mythology, from Kratos' dramatic fight against the Hydra, to the countless Greek gods and goddesses standing between Kratos and his bloody revenge, to Athena and Ares' rivalry that fuels much of Kratos' origin.

That strong integration of mythology carried through to God of War 's Norse Saga, where figures like Baldur, Odin, Thor, and Freya all play key roles in Kratos and Atreus' journey throughout the Nine Realms. The most memorable of these characters are those who pop up throughout the story, reinforcing their unique personality and motivations with each appearance. Such is the case with God of War Ragnarok 's Heimdall, one of the series' best villains that fans love to hate, and an archetype that needs to carry over to the next God of War entry.

The Next God of War Series Should Have Its Own Version of Heimdall

God of War Ragnarok's Heimdall Excelled At His Job

Ripped right from mythology, God of War Ragnarok 's Heimdall has been given the gift of foresight, along with mastery over the Bifrost. Heimdall uses these gifts to mock his adversaries relentlessly.

In God of War Ragnarok , players first meet Heimdall as Atreus is climbing the walls surrounding Asgard. Heimdall mocks Atreus and even attempts to push him to his death, but Atreus manages to hold on and convince Heimdall to let him up, stating Odin wouldn't be pleased if he killed his guest of honor. Though Heimdall agrees to take Atreus to Odin, he instead leads him into an ambush where he sends his Einherjar soldiers to attack the boy.

Throughout the fight, Heimdall teases Atreus. Once the Einherjar have been defeated, he turns to physically bullying Atreus, using his mastery of the Bifrost and his powers of foresight to dodge all of the half-giant's attacks. Heimdall's assault only comes to an end when Thor and Odin appear.

This lengthy introduction to Heimdall does a great job of building a natural rivalry between the player and the Asgardian, with Heimdall's arrogance and brutality encouraging players to want to take revenge. So, later on in God of War Ragnarok 's story when Kratos and Freya set out to kill Heimdall, players should be enthusiastically on board. And when players finally manage to land a hit on the god, and see his arrogant facade crumble into frustration and fear, it's incredibly satisfying.

How The Next God of War Series Could Improve Upon Heimdall's Blueprint

Heimdall's continued antagonization of the player throughout the first two-thirds of God of War Ragnarok makes his ultimate defeat feel all the more rewarding, and if the next God of War wanted to up the ante with its own version of the character archetype, it could extend that period of antagonization. ]

Rather than have the new villain pop up for just the first two-thirds of the next game, they could appear throughout the next God of War saga, taunting Kratos and co. and retreating before their taunts can be stopped for good. By the time players finally get to silence the antagonist, the confrontation could have several games' worth of build-up, leading to a very climactic, cathartic duel.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Leaker Reveals New Loki Skin
item.description:
Summary

  • A prominent Marvel Rivals leaker reveals an upcoming skin for Loki.
  • Loki's new costume features elaborate design elements, possibly related to Lunar New Year.

A prominent Marvel Rivals leaker revealed fresh gameplay footage of an upcoming skin for Loki, which could be debuting in the popular hero shooter very soon. NetEase Games has been busy expanding Marvel Rivals ' offerings, recently announcing that new skins for Moon Knight and Squirrel Girl will be coming to the game on January 3. The developer also stated that it will begin collaborations with several other Marvel games on the same day.

Loki is one of Marvel Rivals' popular Strategists, meaning he provides support and healing to his allies. True to his trickster nature, the hero has a lot of ways to aid teammates while confusing the enemy. For instance, Loki possesses the unique ability to create clones of himself around the battlefield. These copies can mimic his actions to heal or harm nearby characters while also acting as damage sponges. His ultimate ability allows him to temporarily transform into any target and fully utilize their moveset. Despite filling one of the game's most important roles, some players feel the game is a little light on healers. Fortunately, a new leak revealed the villain Ultron could be coming to Marvel Rivals as a Strategist.

In a recent post on Twitter, RivalsInfo revealed gameplay footage of a fresh skin for Loki that could be coming to the game soon. Loki's costume features dark jade and black coloring with large curled horns on his pauldrons and helm. From the back, players can see a tattered gray cape that flows behind the hero as he runs. His usual dark hair appears to be stark white and his signature staff seems to have taken the shape of a scythe. Many fans feel the armored appearance is reminiscent of a dragon, leading some to believe the skin could be associated with the Lunar New Year. RivalsInfo has claimed players could see a new Spider-Man skin in Marvel Rivals associated with the holiday.

Marvel Rivals Leaker Reveals Gameplay Footage of a New Loki Skin

RivalsInfo also posted gameplay footage of a new skin for Magneto in Marvel Rivals . The costume appears to take inspiration from military regalia, showing the hero in a fancy gold and black uniform. Some fans believe this skin could be a nod to Magneto's attire in the famous House of M comic book, but it's not an exact recreation.

Leakers have been working hard to uncover clues within the game's files, and recently revealed that new maps and characters could be coming to Marvel Rivals soon. While there are no release dates associated with these leaks, many players are expecting to see a major expansion to the game when Season 1 launches. With Season 0 coming to a close, a lot of the community seems excited to see what comes next for the popular hero shooter.
